author: cnbc.com
title: MobileIron reports 4Q loss
text:
MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. (AP) _ MobileIron Inc. (MOBL) on Thursday reported a loss of $7.9 million in its fourth quarter.
The Mountain View, California-based company said it had a loss of 8 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for stock option expense and restructuring costs, were less than 1 cent on a per-share basis.
The average estimate of five analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for a loss of 3 cents per share.
The IT company for mobile applications industry posted revenue of $48.8 million in the period, also topping Street forecasts. Four analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $46.5 million.
For the year, the company reported that its loss narrowed to $56.3 million, or 60 cents per share. Revenue was reported as $176.5 million.
For the current quarter ending in April, MobileIron said it expects revenue in the range of $42 million to $45 million.
The company expects full-year revenue in the range of $190 million to $200 million.
In the final minutes of trading on Thursday, the company's shares hit $4. A year ago, they were trading at $4.70.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on MOBL at https://www.zacks.com/ap/MOBL
